CLUE: Relating to verse - based on the metre
OUTPUT: ['Meter - a unit of measurement for length or distance, often used in poetry to refer to the rhythm of the lines.', 'Rhyme - the repetition of similar sounds in two or more words, often used in poetry to create a musical quality.', 'Stanza - a group of lines in a poem, often separated by a blank line or indentation.', 'Limerick - a type of poem with five lines, often with a bouncy rhythm and a humorous or clever conclusion.', 'Sonnet - a poem consisting of 14 lines, often with a specific rhyme scheme and meter.', 'Haiku - a short, three-line poem originating from Japan, often with a nature theme and a syllable count of 5-7-5.', "Free verse - a type of poetry that doesn't follow a regular rhyme or meter pattern, instead relying on the natural rhythm of speech.", "Blank verse - unrhymed iambic pentameter, often used in dramatic works such as Shakespeare's plays.", 'Ballad - a narrative poem with a simple, sing-songy rhythm and a folkloric or romantic theme.', 'Ode - a poem written in praise of a person, place, or thing, often with a formal structure and meter.', 'Lyric - a short poem that expresses personal feelings or emotions, often with a musical quality.', 'Sonnet-a-day - a type of poetry where each day a new sonnet is written, often as part of a yearlong challenge.', 'Poetry slam - a competitive event in which poets perform their work to an audience, often with a focus on performance and delivery rather than technical merit.', 'Acrostic - a poem in which the first letter of each line spells out a word or phrase.', 'Diamante - a type of poem that uses a specific pattern of words and letters, often used to create a sense of balance and harmony.', 'Elegy - a poem written in memory of someone who has died, often with a somber or mournful tone.', 'Ghazal - a Middle Eastern form of poetry that consists of couplets, often with a repeating refrain or phrase.', 'Villanelle - a poem with two main stanzas and a final tercet, in which the first and third lines of the first stanza are repeated throughout the poem in a specific pattern.', 'Concrete poetry - a type of poetry that uses visual arrangement of words on the page to enhance or reinforce the meaning of the poem.', 'Tanka - a Japanese form of poetry that consists of five lines, often with a nature or seasonal theme and a syllable count of 5-7-5-7-7.']
